climbs.name: Target Practice
climbs.fa: (TR) Jim Hammerle, Dave Masuo & Rick Shull, 1990, FL: Brad Singer & Ryan Scherler, November 1999

content.description:
Located on the northwest arete of Camp Rock, just left of

Dave's Crack

(5.6).

climbs.name: Oso Paws Left
climbs.fa: (TR) Bob Cable & Julia Cronk, 1989, FL: Mike Rigney & Ryan Scherler, November 1999

content.description:
Climb easy terrain to a bolt, then into a right-facing corner with a bolt and finish up face (crux) past two more bolts. The anchors on top are a little far back, so be mindful of rope drag.

This route used to have three bolts and require gear between bolts 1 and 3 but is now all bolted.
content.location:
Located on a small, north-facing pillar right of the main Camp Rock and about 25' right of

Dave's Crack

.

content.description: Great route to practice some off-width skills on; hand stacks and leg jamming the whole way.  The start was a little tricky for me because of the difficulty in getting one's feet in the crack. I needed to get about 5' off the ground before my first solid leg jam could hold all my weight.  The crux for me was about 10-15 feet off the ground getting past the bulge of the rock, once you do that, your home free.
content.protection: 2 or 3 large cams (4.5"-7"{Camalot C4 #5 & #6}) used two #4s for the trad anchor to top rope my second from the top.
content.location: Obvious off-width crack about 3m to the left of the "Target Practice" arête.

content.description:
Start up the left-slanting ramp of

Dave's Crack

and then break right up grainy scoops to the top.

Located in the center of the west face of Camp Rock just to the right of

Target Practice

.

Start up a left-slanting ramp to access a short but splitter crack which is over far too quickly. A direct start (5.7) is possible via some face moves. Gear belay and easy downclimb to climber's right.
